fields.headline: Mutya, Real Girl
fields.bodyText: Mutya Buena brought the sass to the Sugababes but the band's commercial edge came from Keisha and Heidi, who both grew up listening to pure pop. And while there are gems on Real Girl there are few quirky enough to match Mutya's peerless vocal charisma. The one big surprise is a huge electro romp with Groove Armada, bizarrely kept back as Mutya's second single when the first - the Lenny Kravitz-sampling 'Real Girl', perfectly pleasant and in parts quite wonderful - still reveals slightly too much about this album's superfluous misfires, which delve too far into limp and forgettable R&B.
